docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16. -- All of the Latin-American Governments whose diplomatic representatives participated in the Pan-American-Mexican conferences with Secretary of State Lansing have given their approval to the plan devised by the conference in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 16. -- All of the Latin-American Governments whose diplomatic representatives participated in the Pan-American-Mexican conferences with Secretary of State Lansing have given their approval to the plan devised by the conference in favor of the recognition of the Carranza faction as the de facto government in Mexico.
docs.abstract: Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Bolivia, Uruguay, and Guatemala agree as to Carranza for recognition

headline.main: ALL NATIONS AGREE AS TO CARRANZA; The Pan-American Conference, Called for Tomorrow, May Decide for Recognition at Once. VILLA REPORTED KILLED Story of Execution by His Own Men Reaches Border, but Is Denied by Secretary.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18. -- Formal announcement was made by Secretary of State Lansing at 4 o'clock this afternoon that tomorrow the Carranza Government in Mexico would be recognized as a de facto Government by the Governments of the United States,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18. -- Formal announcement was made by Secretary of State Lansing at 4 o'clock this afternoon that tomorrow the Carranza Government in Mexico would be recognized as a de facto Government by the Governments of the United States, Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Bolivia, and Uruguay.

headline.main: GIVE RECOGNITION TO CARRANZA TODAY; Decision Announced by Secretary Lansing After Pan-American Conferees' Final Session. CALLED CHIEF EXECUTIVE That Title for Carranza Preferred to "Provisional President" ;- Carranza Troops Take Toluca.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9. -- Venustiano Carranza was formally recognized today as the Chief Executive of the Republic of Mexico by the Governments of the United States, Brazil, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, Uruguay, Guatemala, Colombia and Nicaragua.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 9. -- Venustiano Carranza was formally recognized today as the Chief Executive of the Republic of Mexico by the Governments of the United States, Brazil, Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, Uruguay, Guatemala, Colombia and Nicaragua.
docs.abstract: letter to E. Arredondo announcing recognition of Carranza Govt.

headline.main: CARRANZA PARTY NOW RECOGNIZED; Colombia and Nicaragua Act with Seven States of Pan-American Conference. FLETCHER FOR AMBASSADOR Envoy, Now In Chile, Practically Decided Upon ;- Arredondo to Represent Carranza.

docs.snippet: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Oct. 30. -- The Holy Cross football team defeated the Metuchen team on the cricket field at North Plainfield this afternoon by a score of 14 to 0. The locals scored points in the second and third periods.
docs.lead_paragraph: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Oct. 30. -- The Holy Cross football team defeated the Metuchen team on the cricket field at North Plainfield this afternoon by a score of 14 to 0. The locals scored points in the second and third periods.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: IF there is one thing I dislike more than another it is to spoil a good story. I vividly remember my infantile contempt for the punk-headed pirate who told me that Jack the Giant Killer never existed, and I clearly recall my undying hatred for the...
docs.lead_paragraph: IF there is one thing I dislike more than another it is to spoil a good story. I vividly remember my infantile contempt for the punk-headed pirate who told me that Jack the Giant Killer never existed, and I clearly recall my undying hatred for the iconoclast who calmly informed me that Robinson Crusoe was a myth and his man Friday a black shadow, without life and substance.

headline.main: IN OTHER WORDS, IT ISN'T SO

docs.snippet: Chauncey Eldridge, President of the Federal Holding Company of 55 Cedar Street, which controls the Poulsen wireless telegraph patents in this country and has for three years operated a wireless system between San Francisco and Honolulu, announced...
docs.lead_paragraph: Chauncey Eldridge, President of the Federal Holding Company of 55 Cedar Street, which controls the Poulsen wireless telegraph patents in this country and has for three years operated a wireless system between San Francisco and Honolulu, announced yesterday that the company had obtained a concession from the Argentine Government for the erection of a high-power wireless station at Buenos Aires.
docs.abstract: Prof. M. I. Pupin says that his device for increasing range of wireless telephone is nearly perfected in lecture at meeting of National Academy of Sciences

headline.main: WIRELESS SERVICE DIRECT TO ARGENTINA; Federal Co. Will Send Messages 4,600 Miles from New York to Buenos Aires. 2 TOWERS 1,000 FEET HIGH Rates Will Be a Third Less Than Cable ;- Government Sees a Great Aid to Trade.

docs.snippet: A slightly easier tone developed in the local crude rubber market yesterday after the sharp advance that took place in the last week. It was said to be due to an easing off in the demand on the other side, which had been more active for the last...
docs.lead_paragraph: A slightly easier tone developed in the local crude rubber market yesterday after the sharp advance that took place in the last week. It was said to be due to an easing off in the demand on the other side, which had been more active for the last several days than for some time, and to which the local advances spoken of above were attributed.
docs.abstract: decrease in European demand leads to easier domestic market
